alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 08 at 11:02PM MST until February 08 at 11:15PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MST FOR EL PASO COUNTY... At 1101 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Yoder to Colorado Springs to Pikes Peak, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. ! I-25 Corridor and Highway 24 will be impacted and snow will quickly accumulate on roadways ! Locations impacted include... Colorado Springs, Fountain, Monument, Air Force Academy, Manitou Springs, Calhan, Yoder, Truckton, Black Forest, Ellicott, Peyton, Schriever AFB, Security, Security-Widefield, Falcon, Stratmoor, Gleneagle, Fort Carson, Peterson AFB and Cimarron Hills. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
